column4: One way to find out where the bottle-neck is, would be to check if the kernel is spending a lot of time waiting on I/O "sudo iotop"
I've done that already (second thing actually) and confirmed that a lot of I/O is performed by mount.ntfs for which I blame wubi.
OK, what processes are running when you see the activity for mount.ntfs ? Maybe something is scanning/searching/indexing the disk
I've performed an "apt-get dist-upgrade" and the I/O was caused during the unpacking step. Which is not really surprising, but shouldn't cause *that* much load.
